dialogues.speaker: LONG BASEMENT CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: The CAMERA is MOVING SLOWLY DOWN a long basement corridor We hear a narrator (Werner) --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On his 35th birthday, I decided to tell Julius Benedict the truth about himself...

dialogues.speaker: LABORATORY HALL
dialogues.text: HOLD ON sign:   "Top Secret - Authorized Personnel Only."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't that he was the product of a scientific experiment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A white coated scientist (PROFESSOR WERNER) is studying a bizarre piece of equipment that looks suspiciously like a milkshake blender. With him is another scientist -- (this is TRAVEN -- already imperious, already a prick).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An experiment designed to produce a physically, mentally and spiritually superior human being. I explained that to him when he was two years old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of them young, 20s and 30s. They are being given a medical examination by a group of doctors, including Werner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it wasn't the complexity of Julius's parentage. He knew that unlike other little boys, he didn't have just one, but half a dozen fathers, all very distinguished men.                                   * TWINS - Rev. 4/22/88                                   2.

dialogues.speaker: GORGEOUS WOMAN
dialogues.text: (PERIOD)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not your Hollywood type. This is obviously a lady of character and talent. Her name we will come to learn is MARY ANN BENEDICT. She is on a hospital bed and being readied for surgery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nor was it about the extraordinary woman chosen to be his mother...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traven emerges, sadly shaking his head. Werner tries to enter the room -- Traven won't permit it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius had long lived with the tragic news that she died giving birth to him.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: & 8

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a nurse, parting the security guards, emerges and hold up a plump, serene, smiling baby boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What Julius didn't know, until this very moment, was that, about a minute after he was born...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another nurse emerges from the delivery room, holding up a second INFANT -- this one is SCREAMING with rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His mother gave birth to another baby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The serene baby.    Any mother's joy. The angry baby.    Fuming. PULL BACK to reveal: The two of them are in the same crib. The leg of the angry baby. It suddenly lashes out, connects with the rump of the serene baby: The serene BABY.    Starting to CRY. The angry baby.    All smiles now. HOLD ON the two babies in their crib as the following words fill the screen:

dialogues.speaker: JULIUS, (35)
dialogues.text: He looks up and stares dead AT the CAMERA --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) I have a brother?!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A greenhouse on the island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Werner, now 70, is bent and old. Julius, in peasant garb is a marvelous-looking human being.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (speaks with an Austrian accent) He was sent to an orphanage in Los Angeles. At the same time I brought you here to the island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius isn't listening.    His eyes shine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amazed) I have a twin brother?!! (for a moment, chews on his right thumbnail) What's his name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moved) Vincent -- Every time I loved something I called it Vincent -- I called my first computer Vincent! (suddenly spins; starts off) I have to find him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius strides along a windswept path, followed by Werner. The ocean spread out below them is vast and empty. This island is far from anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fretting terribly) You've been here since you were a baby -- you know nothing of America --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it is the cradle   of democracy and the land   of the free; besides, I speak   twelve languages -- I'm sure I   can get a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're a simple people; rather primitive, not like us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brother will look after me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a blend of modern technology and the tropical environment -- floor-to-ceiling book-cases, computers, a hammock shrouded in a mosquito net. Julius is hurriedly packing a small leather suitcase, watched by Werner. Werner hands over a photograph: it's a picture of a younger Werner, Traven, and the six fathers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your only copy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- My need for it is only sentimental -- yours may be practical --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius slips the photo into his suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you -- I'll miss you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding back the tears) I'll miss you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hug as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The water's edge. Julius, Werner, an OLDER LADY, two scientists and an ORIENTAL man are all saying goodbye. Julius puts his suitcase into a small rowboat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88                                  6.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Julius hugs her)                            *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's sixty miles to the airport,                       * Julius; be careful.                                    * Julius then bows to the Oriental, who bows back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Japanese; subtitled)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was an honor to study under you, Master. Without warning, the Oriental tries to strike Julius in the face with the side of his hand, but Julius blocks the blow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in English)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh, always on guard. You have learned well, Julius-san. Julius gives a last hug to Werner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Werner)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just thinking, maybe my brother Vincent is married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/25/88                                   A6

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if a woman loved my brother enough to marry him, she might have a sister who'd feel the same way about me. That often  happens with twins, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius -- please -- don't get your hopes up. Your brother doesn't even know you exist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius gets in the boat and casts off. The boat takes off like a streak. Julius, in perfect rhythm, increases the pace. The boat is almost flying across the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loudly as he disappears in the horizon) Of course he does. I've always known there was something missing in my life! And deep down, I'm sure Vincent feels the same way! He's probably just like meeeee!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VINCE BENEDICT    lies in bed, looking extremely pleased with himself.     A SEXY YOUNG WOMAN is nestled asleep against him.     The digital bedside ALARM PURRS and star to PLAY MUSIC    -- something romantic that Vince hums al to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sleep well, honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmm... like a baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too. I love this new mattress. It's soft but it's hard at the same time. And I love this new clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla snuggles against Vince as he surveys the bedroom like a house-proud new owner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/25/88                                    B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've done a great job on this room, Carla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really think so?   Even the curtains?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The curtains are the key to the whole thing. They're colorful... they're brilliant... they're... great curtains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (melting) You were great last night, Vince.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not disagreeing) Naaaw... (putting his arm around her) I think we're going to be very happy here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly we hear a DOOR downstairs as it OPENS, and a man's voice drifts up the stairs:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/15/88                                 6A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey!   I'm home!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a bit surprised but not panicked) What's he doing back so early?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince jumps out of bed, starts pulling on his clothes while Carla slips into a bathrobe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla? You gonna cook me some breakfast or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be right down, sweetheart!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince checks his appearance in a dresser mirror, straightens his Armani suit, brushes his hair, pulls it into a fashionable ponytail. He cuts a stylish figure. Noticing an expensive gold lighter on the dresser top, he covertly pockets it. Carla pushes him towards the open French doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up!   I gotta make breakfast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wonderful, Carla. Your husband doesn't deserve to kiss your feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince steps out and  jauntily climbs over the rail. It's very clear he likes  the danger, being on the edge. In another life, he was  probably Errol Flynn. Now, he gives Carla an Errol Flynn  smile -- -- and with that, he leaps into space!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Vince gracefully lands, bounces off it onto the ground He bends, picks up a flower, puts it in the outside pocket of his Armani suit, heads toward a new Mustang parked not far away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Vince gets in, starting to sing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (he's got a good voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Oh what a beautiful morning, Oh what a beautiful day'... Now he does something surprising -- not starting to drive we expect that. What we don't expect is his destination -- because what he does is simply turn the nearest corner and drive right back to the house he just snuck out of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exiting the car, still singing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... 'everything's going my way'...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: where Carla, in her robe, is working away starting to make breakfast. Vince enters, gives her the sweetest smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla, what a joy to look at you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88                                     8

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as she gives him a look) Is my partner and best friend, Al home from work yet? I am the bringer of good tidings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kitchen    door opens and AL GRECO enters. He is sing ing "Happy    Birthday" and carries a wrapped gift held o in front of    him. He's dressed in overalls with an insignia on    his breast pocket that reads "AIRPORT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop with that horrible song, you know how I hate birthdays; they're worse than Christmas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Al presents him with the gift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coy) For me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla and I figured, since you were always admiring mine, what the hell...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/27/88

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Vince struggles to contain his delight at this irony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lighter, just like yours.   I don't know what to say, Al.   I'm all choked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHONE RINGS and Carla picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hello -- the Greco residence... sure. Who may I say is calling... Mr. Burt Klane? Vince, it's for you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince confidently picks up the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Good morning, Mr. Klane. I hope you're having a wonderful -- (cut off) Yes -- no problem -- I have it. Yes. Today. Of course. 'Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing talking to a loanshark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) That's part of my good news -- You know that money I picked up from the Jaguar we boosted. Well,                      * I put the money in the stock                           * market. I got this incredible                          * tip.                                                   *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't lose. Ever hear of P.V.T. Industries? Probably not -- Secret takeover bid --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/27/88                                   10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You put the money on a stock?                        *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very special stock -- and it was such a sure thing -- I borrowed another 20 grand from the Klane                      * Brothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unbelieving) You borrowed from a loan shark to invest in the stock market?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On margin -- And as of last night I was ten thousand ahead. I'm                        * going to make a fortune -- turn on the T.V.

dialogues.speaker: TV
dialogues.text: Cable news -- stock report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... that Wall Street's suffering its worst single-day's losses since October '87. Hardest hit                       * were Federated Broadcasting, down $18, Waverton Data, down $24 and P.V.T. Industries, down $32. Analysts speculate that even blue chip stocks will not remain immune to...

dialogues.speaker: INT. AL'S HOUSE- DAY
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP ON the extremely worried face of Vince as he takes in the bad news.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are having one shitty birthday, Vince.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/27/88                                    1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm wiped out. I got to get some money -- fast.                                          *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... '88 B.M.W. came in for long term last night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think you're doing this too often?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a desperate man.                                    *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Level three.   Stall 25.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 27

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSEUP ON a large painted number 25 then PAN DOWN to reveal a new BMW. Vincent approaches the BMW and pretends to be searching for his keys while he waits for another car to pull out and drive away. The second it's gone, Vince deftly opens the BMW door with a "slim-Jim." He gets behind the wheel, hot wires the ignition and drives away. Vince is a pro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The green BMW is already being repainted by some Men wearing goggles and using spray guns. Vince comes out of an office, counting a wad of bills, followed by the OWNER of the chop shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/15/88                                   12

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is only four thousand --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in a recession -- Everything's tough -- you want to try someone else -- no hard feelings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sourly) Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay, Vince? You seem a little worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? I laugh myself to sleep every night, and I never sleep alone. I'm doing great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Owner smiles and turns. Vince continues counting the money, nervous as hell. Now --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/22/88                                  14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flying through clear, blue skies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming down the aisle, checking the passengers, as we hear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Put on your red dress, baby 'Cause we're going out tonight...' A few passengers turn and look back at --

dialogues.speaker: JULIUS
dialogues.text: seated in the rear, still in his peasant garb, the bamboo suitcase resting on his lap. He has his headphones on and is singing along to the music, his eyes closed and his head bobbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'I better wear some boxing gloves, In case some fool might want to fight.' The STEWARDESS removes his headphones and considers Julius with amusement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew you were trouble the second I laid eyes on you. Julius stares up at her, speechless and mesmerized.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry -- I've never heard this music before -- I love it.                             * She sighs, leans over him, fastens his seat belt, while Julius gazes down at her ample cleavage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The captain wants us to buckle our seat belts because we're expecting a little turbulence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading her name tag)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Betty Lou.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/27/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you're a football player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I'm a horticultural botanist, a mathematician, and a philosopher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.    And I'm a brain surgeon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Stewardess heads back up the aisle, a MAN jumps up, grabs her around the neck with one arm and brandishes a gun in his other hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to passengers) Nobody   moves, or else we're gonna have a   serious draft in here. (turns to another stewardess) Get the   captain. I want to discuss   our final destination.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He continues maneuvering the Stewardess up the aisle. His back is totally to Julius now.

dialogues.speaker: JULIUS
dialogues.text: turns to the terrified elderly woman beside him who's clutching a hardcover Bible in her lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Excuse me, ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he takes the book from her, quickly draws back his arm --

dialogues.speaker: HIGHJACKER
dialogues.text: The gun at the panicked Stewardess's head, he continues slowly up the aisle, shouting for everyone to freeze, not even to think about moving -- -- now a hardcover book comes rocketing through the air, hits him in the back of the neck and he goes limp, fall- ing across some seats, the gun dropping from his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/27/88                                   16

dialogues.speaker: BUNCH OF PASSENGERS
dialogues.text: grabbing him, all of them brave and heroic -- a lot of commotion -- shouts of "I've got him," "Don't move," etc.

dialogues.speaker: HAND
dialogues.text: retrieving the hardcover Bible from the floor and --

dialogues.speaker: OLD WOMAN
dialogues.text: as Julius smiles reassuringly, returns her Bible to her, sits back in his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently; calming her) His mischief shall return upon his own hand, and his violent dealing shall come down upon his own head -- Psalm 7:16.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In front now, there is a lot of activity as various pass- engers hold the Highjacker, almost arguing over who's in control. Julius looks at them a moment, puts on his headset, closes his eyes and is soon bopping away to the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the plane circles to land.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius exits the terminal surrounded by Orientals.     He makes his way to an airport shuttle bus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/2/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Vince sidles into a booth, watched by a BARTENDER who clearly dislikes him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's him.    He's back. A pretty young cocktail waitress called MARNIE turns and stares daggers at Vince. Marnie is a fireball of a girl, all brass and sass on the outside and sweet as cotton candy on the inside, sort of a Jean Harlow valley girl. She approaches Vince, who greets her with effusive warmth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marnie! How are you?        Is your sister around? Marnie pointedly scoops up the tip left by the previous occupants of the booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marnie starts to wipe down the table, spilling crumbs int his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You total Linda's car. You pawn her stereo. You declare us as dependents on your tax return!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What an amazing memory --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince!   I knew you'd come back! Marnie's sister, LINDA, also a cocktail waitress, slips into the booth and gives Vince a big kiss. Linda, although just as attractive as her younger sister, has a completely different personality: she's trusting, dependent, and legally blind when it comes to Vincent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Linda)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so sorry for all the miserable things I've done to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/2/88                                   18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Marnie) I'm not going to give him any money. Just take care of my station for a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marnie exchanges an exasperated glance with the Bartender and walks away. Linda distances herself a little from Vince in the booth, not meeting his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emotionally) I didn't come here for a loan, sweetheart. I came to say goodbye. (beat)                                       * It's not safe for me here. People are trying to kill me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince starts to rise but Linda pulls him back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you do, Vince?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got involved in the stock market.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting nervous) I promised Marnie I wouldn't give you money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince takes Linda's hand between his and stares into her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look at me like that... Don't do that with your eyes... I shouldn't even be here with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) You are here and so am I, Maybe millions of people go by, But they all disappear from view, And I only have eyes for you... Linda. I only have eyes for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moved) That is so beautiful. How do you make up that stuff? You're such a poet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/2/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You inspire me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man enters. He starts looking around, checking the booths. He looks like a professional enforcer, which in fact, he is. He is also the smallest of the Klane brothers: BURT KLANE. Vince ducks down under the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) It's the baby Klane -- I gotta get the hell out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt Klane strolls to the middle of the room, then sudden turns and faces Linda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the little shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very nervous) You gotta be more specific, considering our clientele.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) He wouldn't show his face around here. Right, Marnie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks down at --

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: He silently starts to crawl away in the direction of the back door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enjoying calling him names) Who, Vincent?                                           *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/2/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- That weasel, that creep -- that oily little slug -- that two-bit, two-timing, waste of space -- that pathetic, low-life pocket Romeo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting her off) Okay -- enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back door opens and Vince crawls out on hands and knees. His journey abruptly ends as he now faces KLANE #2 -- BOB -- considerably larger than his brother inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince is thrown in, forcefully, into a table.        He c onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look what I found crawling around out back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A booth at the back of the restaurant: Vince is seated with the two Klane brothers. He hands over the money he picked up from the BMW -- $4000. The smaller Klane counts it quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is only four thousand --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rest is invested.     We're gonna make a fortune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob suddenly punches Vince in the side knocking the breat out of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ominous) Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/2/88

dialogues.speaker: C37 CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Linda comes over -- Very nervous, she looks around, then hands over an envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope this helps -- Please don't hurt him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There you go -- (he counts Linda's money) -- Another thousand -- Okay -- This nice lady just bought you a day Vince -- I want it all -- Twenty- thousand -- this time tomorrow.                        *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty -- ?   But I just paid --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as he opens his mouth, Vince is elbowed again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's just the interest.    The                       * twenty's the principal.                                *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda is walking Vince out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was the most wonderful birthday present anybody ever gave me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your birthday?   Why didn't you tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly honest) I can't take the kindness.    It gives me the shakes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll tremble plenty before we're through, Vince Benedict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/27/88                                 23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince brushes himself off, hesitates a moment, pulling on his left ear with his right hand. Immediately behind him, facing the opposite direction, is another man, also pulling on his left ear with his right hand. It is Julius -- -- Their backs are to each other. Without ever catching sight of one another, they move off, going their separate ways. Now, from this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Downtown Hollywood in all it's sleeze. There's a wax museum and a scientology center and every fast food place imaginable and people shouting as they sell things, "flowers" and street food and there's a porno house showing Tight 'n Tender and there's young people dressed like punks and old people boozed out and pimps and druggies and guys slumped unconscious in the gutter and crowds of tourists walking this way, that way, and there' noise and litter and one more thing -- -- There's Julius, case in hand, staring around, taking i all in. We're a long way from his island now. He studies all the humanity swirling around him --

dialogues.speaker: JULIUS
dialogues.text: And you can see it on his face:   He loves it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost a whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... How wonderful...

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 43

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius, eating a hot dog, is walking along a street in Hollwyood. In his island peasant garb, he doesn't look all that unusual considering his surroundings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/2/88

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: But Julius is pretty noticable no matter where he goes.

dialogues.speaker: TWO HELMETLESS MOTORCYCLISTS
dialogues.text: watching Julius. More specifically, they are watching the expensive-looking leather-edged suitcase he carries i his hand. They look at the case a moment more, then Biker #2 gets his MACHINE PURRING softly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never saw such lingerie. PULL BACK to reveal: Julius, staring at it, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) What an amazing country.

dialogues.speaker: BIKER
dialogues.text: ROARING up beside Julius, smiling ingratiatingly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a light, pal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, but I don't smoke... pal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius thinks he's found a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating "Fredericks") Looking for something for your girl friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... don't have a girl friend. Do women really wear these things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're lucky. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You from out of town?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/2/88                                    25

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, a small island in the South                      * Pacific, about 300 nautical miles south-southwest of Fiji...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Biker #2,   bounds along, and when he reaches Julius he grabs the   handle of the leather case that Julius holds, his plan   quite obvious -- to steal the case and disappe into the   crowded street. Not an original plan, certainly, but one that over and over again, always works --

dialogues.speaker: CASE HANDLE
dialogues.text: Julius's hand holds fast to it.    Then --

dialogues.speaker: BIKER
dialogues.text: As his mouth drops open as we --

dialogues.speaker: JULIUS
dialogues.text: just sort of standing there, no big deal, not much effort showing on his face as Biker #2 begins to slowly rise into the air as he and his cycle are about to be parted and then --

dialogues.speaker: CYCLIST
dialogues.text: still holding to the case as his CYCLE ZOOMS away from him and for a moment he is flat in mid-air, parallel to the cement sidewalk and --

dialogues.speaker: RIDERLESS MOTORCYCLE
dialogues.text: ROARING into the crowd and people shriek, dive out of its way and --

dialogues.speaker: CYCLIST
dialogues.text: falling to the pavement, his head colliding hard and he's out and --

dialogues.speaker: RIDERLESS CYCLE
dialogues.text: ending its trip as it collides with a storefront and collapses on its side, MOTOR still ROARING but no movement anymore and --

dialogues.speaker: CYCLIST
dialogues.text: stunned, going to his unconscious partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Julius) What the hell did you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius calmly kneels beside the still form. He puts his case down, and his hands move expertly across the prone figure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did nothing, the pavement was his enemy.

dialogues.speaker: JULIUS
dialogues.text: eyes almost closed as his skilled hands touch the guy a moment more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would say -- a concussion -- a mild shoulder separation, and ribs four to seven are cracked. Julius rises.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him to a hospital. And now he picks up his case, starts to go; pauses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in the future, you should both consider wearing helmets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sweet smile.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 47

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince, approaching his car, sees a motorcycle COP putting a ticket under his windshield wiper. Vince marches over, examines the ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty-three dollars?   You gotta be kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your vehicle's in a handicapped zone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince immediately hunches his shoulder and affects a limp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?    Do I look normal to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have a 'handicapped' sticker on your windshield. (a beat) Driver's license, please.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE'S HAND
dialogues.text: It is being handcuffed to his car's door handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got over 200 outstanding parking tickets, Mr. Benedict. And you just had your birthday? Well, your driver's license just expired -- Happy birthday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/27/88

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: As we HOLD ON Vince's depressed face we FADE TO BLACK --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius walks up the stairs leading to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young boys in uniform are raucously enjoying their recess under the supervision of several nuns in habits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, this is where my brother grew up. I'm glad he had so many friends to play with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An elderly MOTHER SUPERIOR looks dubiously at Julius as he stares out the window down on the playground. He turns and examines the dormitory which is lined with metal cots. He points to a cot near the door and smiles fondly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's where he must have slept.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the one I would have chosen. It's next to the fire extinguisher. In case of a fire, I could have given the alarm, and saved the other orphans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've only had one fire at St. Charlotte's. Vince Benedict started it, we like to think by accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/15/88                                  28A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mother Superior opens a file cabinet and begins rummaging through it, watched by Julius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about him. Was he a good athlete? Did he like chess and poetry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/27/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm certain that God had a purpose when he created Vincent Benedict, but it had nothing to do with chess or poetry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She locates a file, removes it; the only thing inside it is a photograph, which falls to her desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's odd... the contents of his file are missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius picks up the photo -- a 13-year-old boy leering up at an attractive young nun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is him?   He looks happy --                        *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighing) He should -- that's Sister Maria,                       * his biology teacher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always liked biology.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So did Vincent. He disgraced Sister Maria, who had to leave the order. Then he stole all the money from our library fund and ran away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mother Superior is trying, tactfully, to close the door on Julius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I have to find him.   Where do you think he might be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jail. A man of his character could only be in jail. You're full of goodness, Julius -- I pray that you never find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet smile as the door is closed and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/27/88                                   30

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bunch of people are in the cell along with Vince. Most noticable is an amazingly tall, slender, muscular black man. We're talking a SEVEN FOOTER here. A bad tempered Seven Footer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Vince who is scowling at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you lookin' at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At you, you jerk. The Seven Footer rises angrily to his full size. Vince moves right in on him -- he may be going through a bad patch, but make no mistake, Vince is tough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the others in the cell)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tyrone Davis, averaged 23 points, eleven rebounds and four blocks a game his senior year. First round pick of the L.A. Clippers and now look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned by the amount of information)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who're you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he gives Tyrone a card)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: World International Athletics                           * Representation. Vincent Benedict -- President. I coulda got you a no-cut contract so you wouldn't have to heist T.V. sets for a living --

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: coming to the cell door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Benedict!    Visitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moving away) Call me when you get out, they're always looking for centers in Italy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as he goes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius is already seated in one of the cubicles, separate by a glass partition from the prisoner's side. This is a big moment for Julius and he looks around as various prisoners are brought in -- -- and as a look of pleasure comes across his face --

dialogues.speaker: GUARD
dialogues.text: leading an attractive, powerful inmate into the room. The guy is Julius's age.

dialogues.speaker: JULIUS
dialogues.text: trying to fight his excitement, watching as the prisoner moves toward him -- -- then past him. Julius, confused, stares for a moment straight ahead across the partition, and now he's more confused -- -- because Vince is sitting across from him, dubiously studying him, arms crossed. There are phones on both sides of the glass partition. The room, it should be noted, is busy. Julius makes a smile. Vince just stares. Julius mutters "excuse me" and gets up, goes to a nearby GUARD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (soft) Excuse me, but I'm looking for Vincent Benedict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing to Vince) You got 'im.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius turns, looks at Vince, and as he walks back to his side of the cubicle and sits, he is overcome with the wonder of it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impassioned, but a bit rambling; his emotions are in control) Vincent... dearest Vincent... I have rowed halfway across the world -- no, wrong, I only rowed one day but I came halfway across                     * the world -- I know you don't know who I am, but believe me when I say I have been waiting for this                      * moment all my life...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard to tell what Vince is feeling but clearly the look of dubiousness is gone. He picks up the phone on his side, gestures for Julius to do the same. As Julius does, Vince at last speaks:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta talk into the phone,                        * asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius is confused, momentarily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (understands now -- into the phone) Vincent...

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: listening, somewhat amazed.    Who is this loony?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Dearest Vincent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince glances quickly around to see that no one is listening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/27/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you don't know who I am, but -- I came halfway across the world --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting in) -- Whoa. I still got another six hours to pay the money back. You tell those crummy Klane brothers that harassing a man when he's already in the slammer is beneath even them --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping -- they do this a lot) -- I don't know any Klane brothers. I'm your brother, Julius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stopped dead) Huh?    Again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know any Klane Brothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wary) Yeah.   Go on -- I got that part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Julius -- I'm your twin brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Obviously -- the minute I sat down I felt like I was looking in a mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not identical twins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't be too sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/27/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sad) You don't believe a word I've said, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- That's right. I don't believe a word you said.                                        *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincent, I don't lie. I am your brother. Let me help you get out                        * of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (now he's interested) Oh... you want to help me get outta here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, money talks, bullshit walks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can bullshit walk?   Is that slang?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) I'm in fast company here -- (to Julius) Listen, you get me outta here, I'll be whatever you want, best friend, brother, nephew, niece, grandma...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince gets up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself as he leaves) Just don't ask me to bend over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bunch of impounded cars. Vince and Julius walk toward a small building in the center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/27/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, 'twinny,' I hope you didn't blow your wad on those tickets, 'cause it's gonna cost a bunch more to release my car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have some more money --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am happy to help you, Vincent. You're my brother. I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius -- look -- ease up on the love talk or I'm gonna be tossing my cookies, all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tossing cookies, that is more slang?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just gimme your wallet, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Julius sweetly hands it over --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Julius counts out almost the last of his money to the police attendant, who hands him a set of keys. Vince grabs them and walks out of the building. Julius follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you're thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're thinking that this whole twin business is what you call 'bullshit.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/2/88

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: This is exactly what Vince has been thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I was thinking I'm going to need some more money -- to put gas in my car --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can take some more money --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're brothers -- right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius tries to drape an arm around Vince's shoulder. Vince gives him a look. Julius drops his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince and Julius are walking down a long line of cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrest you, they put you behind bars, they fine you and then they hide your car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's -- (points) -- your car, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: VINCE'S MUSTANG
dialogues.text: Which is what Julius is pointing at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah --   How'd you know that was my car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're twins!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/27/88                                   37

dialogues.speaker: A58 CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Vince unlocks his side, gets in. Julius, smiling and happy, starts to walk around to the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very happy) I'm so excited -- we'll go to museums together, discuss philosophy together, read books together -- play chess together --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Get lost together -- And on that, he GUNS his CAR the hell away, leaving Julius standing there.

dialogues.speaker: JULIUS
dialogues.text: Deserted, alone in the sea of cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a gleaming new Cadillac rolls up to the ticket booth. Al leans out from the booth, taking in the car and its occupants -- two men, one in a Hawaiian shirt, one in a tanktop, both wearing Ray-Bans. They look like they're going on vacation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 6/22/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, the new Sedan DeVille... Very nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver, GARFIELD, just nods, holds out his hand for the ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys must be going to Hawaii, huh? Catch that good surf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two men just stare straight ahead, uninterested in conversation. Al hands the driver a ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's plenty of space on level four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cadillac accelerates up the ramp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as it pulls into a parking spot in the enclosed lot. Man #2, LARSON, opens an attache case, removes a cassette, inserts it into the tape deck while the driver wipes down the steering wheel, gearshift, etc. with a cloth to remove their fingerprints.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE CADILLAC
dialogues.text: as the men get out, lock the car, wipe off the door handles, and then head for the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Vince approaches a door on which a sign reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His door opens and out come two furniture MOVERS with a desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 6/22/88                                    3

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing with my desk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taking back the furniture -- you're six months behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens a desk drawer, pulls out a razor and begins shaving as he walks into his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost nothing is left but the phone on the floor, with Miss Busby, his secretary, standing by it. Vince is stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to stop them, Mr. Benedict --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was time to redecorate anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHONE RINGS -- Miss Busby drops to her knees beside it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Vincent Benedict, Incorporated -- Sports agent, artist's representative -- import/export -- automobile sales, rentals, and leasing -- wholesale patio furniture -- How may I help you? (listens briefly) Oh, hi. (to Vince) It's Al.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she hands him the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking it, talking to her, sweetly) Miss Busby -- Stacy -- this is a transition period for the corporation -- Why don't you take a few days off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little lost) ... Aah -- all right. Whatever you say, Mr. Benedict...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 6/22/88                                   39

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stops)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, before I forget... Happy birthday... She hands him a gift-wrapped present which he opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/22/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Aqua-Velva' -- you shouldn't have --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes her purse, smiles, goes.    When he's alone, into phone:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope you got some good news,                         * Al --                                                  *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the phone in his ticket booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Brand new Caddy on level four.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thrilled) Great, I'll be right over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince drops to his knees in order to replace the phone into its receiver. He then scrambles up, straightens his suit, heads for the door, making sure his pony tail is perfect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Vince exits, turns, quickly locks the door, turns back into the corridor just in time for this -- -- A huge fist slams brutally into his stomach.     Vince gags, falls to his knees as we: PULL BACK to reveal MORRIS KLANE, the biggest of them all standing over Vince.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time's up, Vincent -- Got the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/15/88

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He bends over, picks Vince up by the neck like a toy doll straightens him up briefly, then buries his fist into Vince's gut. Vince goes down. Harder than last time.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: In agony, on his knees. It hurts to breath.       He fina manages to look up at the giant --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasping) Did you hit me yet? 'Cause I didn't feel nothin'.

dialogues.speaker: MORRIS KLANE
dialogues.text: He grabs Vince again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta understand something, Benedict -- I like my work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls  Vince groggily up and this time he's going for Vince's  face. He takes his time setting Vince up, getting  his chin at just the right angle. He's concen- trating  on his work, so he doesn't pay much attention to the fact  that the elevator door has opened behind. Klane draws   his fist back and is about to drive it into Vince's face   when he suddenly pauses; the expression on his face, at   first puzzled, becomes increasingly agoniz as we REVEAL   that --

dialogues.speaker: JULIUS
dialogues.text: Behind him, is squeezing a pressure point on Klane's neck, rendering him unable to punch out Vince. Julius maneuvers the Klane off of Vince and forces him down onto the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly) These are most unfriendly acts you are committing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (totally surprised) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/22/88                                    4

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what the problem is, but I'm sure it can be solved without resorting to violence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (absolutely in agreement) Okay, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.                                                 *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius lets go of Klane, who gets to his feet, turns around, and instantly lets fly with his fist at Julius's face. Here Julius effortlessly blocks the punch and goes right on talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You moved too soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klane spins and aims a karate kick at Julius's head. Julius coolly ducks it and sends Klane crashing into a wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An important rule in a crisis                         * situation -- negotiate first, attack last. You never negotiated. You don't know what kind of enemy I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klane drags himself to his feet while trying to gauge wha he's up against.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincent's brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (happily) We're twins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klane isn't buying it. Seeing a fire axe inside a GLASS CASE on the wall, he SMASHES through and grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're firewood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/22/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no respect for logic --                        *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Klane charges Julius, who sidesteps his blow. The axe is is imbedded in the wall. As Julius grabs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And I have no respect for those with no respect for logic. You're a very stupid person.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: Watching as Julius picks up Klane with both hands and lifts him a foot up into the air, holding him there for a pause.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: -- And this next is timed perfectly -- as he pushes the elevator button and...

dialogues.speaker: ELEVATOR DOOR
dialogues.text: slides open and...

dialogues.speaker: JULIUS
dialogues.text: As he heaves Klane across the corridor into the open elevator Klane crashes down hard just as the door slides shut and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/22/88

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: Shouting as the door closes on the crumpled Klane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell your brother 'He messes with me, he messes with my whole family!'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Despite himself, Vince is definitely warming to Julius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (happy) I like it when you hit people!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate violence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're so good at it. We ought to go into business together. You could be a boxer and I'll be your manager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I could fight for money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem. You do the fighting, I'll keep all the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) I'm worried about you, Vincent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach Vince's Mustang and get in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much money do you owe? Don't lie -- we're twins, I can feel your pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (exploding) Why do you keep saying that? We're not twins, we're not brothers, we're nothing, and you're only in this car because I could use a little protection these days --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/27/88                                   45

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (closing his eyes) Twenty thousand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat; then, quietly) Due this morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Vince bangs his forehead with the palm of his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know where my head is -- I forgot I promised this friend of mine -- Sammy -- I'd pick up his car at the airport -- do me a big favor, okay? Drive this car back from the airport for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius reaches into the glove compartment, takes out the car manual, begins speed reading it, running his index finger down the center of each page.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing with that finger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Learning to drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince isn't sure what's going on at this point. Now Julius studies Vince's shifting moves, the way his hands work the steering wheel. Now he's back to the manual. Now he's staring at Vince. Vince and Julius's heads are both in motion now -- Julius's from the book to the wheel, Vince's from the road to Julius's finger. As their heads keep turning --

dialogues.speaker: A65 OMITTED
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/27/88                                  46/

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince checks beneath the caddy's tires, then rises, frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That dopey Sam -- He did it again. Forgot to leave the keys... A lot of handicapped kids are gonna be really disappointed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (moved)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handicapped children?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This car was supposed to be auctioned off at their charity drive tomorrow. Oh, well, let's go eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should try to open it ourselves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince raises his eyebrows in mock surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think we should do a thing like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course -- it's for the children...

dialogues.speaker: SLIM JIM
dialogues.text: Vince inserts it into the Cadillac's driver's-side window, watched by Julius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feigning ignorance) I saw a guy from the auto club do this once...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door locks suddenly pop up in unison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whaddya know?    Beginner's luck!

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: As he takes a breath, opens the door, scoots inside -- -- and the instant he does there is this terrible shrieking SIREN sound -- -- Vince frantically scrambles around, lying on the car seat, trying to make it stop but he can't -- -- and then two things happen:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )O(   TWINS - Rev. 7/5/88

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: First, the car tilts and Vince is pitched unceremoniously forward, landing on the floor of the car under the steer- ing wheel. He scrambles back to the seat -- it's not easy because of the angle. Second, the SIREN STOPS.    Vince looks out the car windo

dialogues.speaker: JULIUS
dialogues.text: holding the rear of the car several feet up in the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When the back end is raised to an angle greater than 45 degrees, a mercury switch activates the automatic cutoff system. The alarm's computer thinks the car is being towed away and shuts off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beginning to dawn on Vince that there may be more to Julius than meets the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cadillac passes by, Vince at the wheel. A pause. Now the Mustang comes along, Julius at the wheel. He drives terribly, stopping and starting -- jerking along. Julius suddenly puts his foot on the gas and roars past Vincent.

dialogues.speaker: DUSK
dialogues.text: Julius is speeding like a kid with a new toy. Suddenly the CAR PHONE BEEPS. He locates the source of the sound, and picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Vincent Benedict's car. (a beat) Vincent! Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )T(   TWINS - Rev. 7/5/88 PM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya see that little dot in your rearview mirror? That's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving into mirror) Hi, Vincent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a supermarket up ahead. Take your foot off the gas and very -- very -- very gently put it on the brake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The brake -- right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Julius makes a sharp turn -- on two wheels -- into the parking lot and comes to a dramatic squealing stop that spins the car around 180 degrees. Vince's car pulls in a moment later. He gets out, gazes at the skid marks as a smiling Julius approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The brakes worked just fine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme tell you something about America, Julius -- nobody likes a smart-ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius and Vince enter the supermarket.

dialogues.speaker: LINDA AND MARNIE
dialogues.text: are pushing a cart down one of the other aisles. Linda is filling it with birthday candles, cake mixes, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )T(   TWINS - Rev. 7/5/88 PM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as she reaches for some cake mix) Angel's food or devil's food?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The answer's obvious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only one Vince Benedict. He's a force of nature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )O(   TWINS - Rev. 7/5/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that 'poetry' he pretends to write. They're old song lyrics, Linda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda stops pushing the cart and looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that -- Geez, you don't think I know that -- ? (soft) It's so cute, the way he thinks he's tricking me. Anyway, what's wrong about other people's songs? Some guys tell you dirty jokes. It just proves that Vince has a romantic soul.

dialogues.speaker: MAGAZINE RACK
dialogues.text: Adjacent to the express checkout lane where Linda and Marnie now join the line. Julius picks up a Playboy and begins speed-reading it. His eyes widen at what he's reading, and seeing, and when he reaches the centerfold he audibly gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She reaches past Julius to take a copy of Cosmopolitan. Julius drops the Playboy, which falls open on the ground, with the centerfold revealed. Flustered and blushing, he bends down to retrieve it, watched by Marnie, who can't take her eyes off the sheer beauty of his physique.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at the centerfold) She's not bad...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) I'm sorry. I had no idea these magazines had things like that... inside them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius tries to stuff the centerfold back into the maga- zine, but only manages to crumple it. Linda and Marnie exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )O(   TWINS - Rev. 7/5/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't? Where've you been? (gulping) A desert island?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a matter of fact, a small tropical island, in the South Pacific, about 300 nautical miles south-southwest of Fiji. I only got here yesterday, but already                        * I've found my wonderful brother.                       *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right... They all turn and look at Vince, who's pulled his cart up behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (proudly) My twin brother, Vincent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda and Marnie, stunned, look from Vince to Julius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Linda) God you look beautiful in this light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince... ?   I didn't know you had a brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all know each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius, meet Linda and... (sarcastic) Her charming sister, Marnie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (significant) Sisters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Julius) Twins?

dialogues.speaker: A68 OMITTED
dialogues.text: )O(   TWINS - Rev. 7/5/88

dialogues.speaker: B68 OUTSIDE THE SUPERMARKET
dialogues.text: The girls stand holding their bags while the brothers are each in their cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye girls, see you soon. And he guns off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (waving)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodbye girls, see you soon. And he guns off too -- only in his excitement he's gone into reverse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've only been drivng for an hour. Now he follows Vince.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do I think I'm going to see him again? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like maybe tomorrow. TWINS - Rev. 4/27/88                                  55/

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince leads Julius from the garage to the front door. Julius is carrying all the grocery bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda is your girl friend, isn't she?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   Kind of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Marnie your girl friend, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marnie! Marnie hates my guts. She seemed to like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying not to sound too interested)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hardly knows me. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the best way --   women love men who are mysterious   and devious. It keeps them on their   toes -- makes them excited you   know what I mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do like women, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/15/88                                   56

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very much, they're... strange and sensitive and they have compassion. I have the highest respect for women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince listens to this earnest declaration and tries to keep a straight face. Suddenly the truth dawns on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now correct me if I'm wrong. You're a virgin, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's private.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/27/88                                   57

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Vince clocks Julius's reaction as he removes an eviction notice from his front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) He's a 230-pound virgin.                              *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a small one-bedroom decorated primarily with garden furniture. As they come inside, Vince is confronted by a reproachfully MEOWING CAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to cat) Alright! Alright! I got your food. Yes! 'Liver and Cheese,' 'Chicken Giblets,' all your favorites, Julius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You named your cat, Julius? Vince freezes, realizing the implications.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince is seasoning some containers of take-out food and popping them in the microwave, while Julius strokes the cat who shares his name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The secret to take-out veal Parmesan is adding a little extra cheese. I know you're probably used to growing your own vegetables and spearing fish in the lagoon, but here on the mainland we just nuke it! The microwave ALARM sounds, and it pops open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dinner is served!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Vince and Julius prepare to eat, they both turn their plates counter-clockwise, then dab their lips with their napkins. They both reach for the salt at the same moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/27/88                                   58

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They both freeze and stare at each other for a long beat. Julius smiles and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man, pushing forty, appears, taking a keychain with a caddy fob on it from his pocket. This is WEBSTER. Dressed in businessman's clothing, he looks odd -- but no necessarily frightening. He walks to the spot where the car was.

dialogues.speaker: PARKING SPOT
dialogues.text: It's definitely empty.

dialogues.speaker: WEBSTER
dialogues.text: He looks at the Cadillac key.    Clearly, he is not happy the turn of events.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've finished eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (expansive) So, let me get this right. One of                    * our fathers was a famous football player, another one was a physicist at M.I.T. --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won the Nobel Prize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince, playing along, rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naturally... so all of our dads were these big shots and Mom was, like, Superwoman, but she didn't survive our delivery. I got sent to an orphanage while you were brought up in a tropical paradise by this scientist you do research for, but who doesn't actually pay you because you don't need money. (a beat) Did I leave anything out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius ignores Vince's cynicism.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's important we try to find our fathers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, all those geniuses who contributed to the... (making a jerk-off gesture) ... Sperm milkshake?                                   *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you being so immature about this?                                            *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince throws down his napkin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know how many times I've heard stories like this? It's every orphan's fantasy: 'My real Mom and Dad were rich and beautiful, but there was a mix-up at the hospital and I got switched with another baby... But one day there's going to be a knock at the door and there they'll be with open arms, crying... "My darling! My treasure! We didn't know! How can we make it up to you?"' (a beat) I'm telling you this for your own good, Julius. It's a crock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince goes over to a trunk, rummages in it, comes up with a dusty mouldering folder from which he removes a yellow- ing piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88                                   60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I liberated this from my file at the orphanage. Read it and weep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius takes the paper and reads aloud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Sister Anderson, your request for orphans benefits for Vincent Benedict has been denied. According to our files his mother did not die during birth. We have a current address for her at 172 Canyon Glen Drive, Los Angeles. Vincent's case seems to be one of simple abandonment and as such he is inelligible for aid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince snatches the paper back.    Julius stares at him, just stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, Julius, she abandoned me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This letter was written thirty                      * years ago. We were five years old                   * -- Our mother... didn't die when we were born... (staring at Vince now) You've known all this time where she was and you never contacted her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) I don't know about your momma, Miss Perfect of 1952, but my momma was a slut, and if she's still alive, I hope she's in a lot of pain. She dumped me once -- no way she gonna get a chance to do it again --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincent, if they lied to us about Momma for all these years, maybe they lied to her, too. We must find her, we must check this address.                                            *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88                                    61

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He can't hide the excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius -- slow down -- I've got no time for this. You go hunt down                       * Mom, I've got a cash flow problem                     * to deal with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince goes to the PHONE which is RINGING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) What!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't forgotten about you, Benedict -- You better have our money tomorrow morning. Or else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or else what? Suddenly, Vince's    living room WINDOWS EXPLODE in a bur of GUNFIRE. Vince     and Julius hit the floor and try to shield themselves    from the SHATTERING GLASS. The sound of a CAR SQUEALING    away outside the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone seems so angry in America.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: A sign in front reads:     "SOUTHLAND AEROSPACE."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver of the Cadillac (GARFIELD), and his partner (LARSON), now dressed in suits and ties, walk along an executive corridor toward the reception area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tests on the lower temperature gaskets look great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like an easy weekend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they head for Garfield's office, a SECRETARY tries to hail them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/27/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (concerned) Mr. Garfield, there's a...                             *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (preoccupied) Not now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they enter they suddenly stop and stare as we... PULL BACK to reveal -- Webster, immaculate and well mannered, rising from a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (friendly) I'm Webster, it's okay.

dialogues.speaker: GARFIELD
dialogues.text: on the sound of the name.      He looks at Larson.   A be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terribly upset) Christ, man, you were never                            * supposed to come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rattled) The deal was we were never supposed to meet. You're supposed to be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driving that Cadillac to Texas? (holds up his gloved hands) Got my driving gloves, got my driving glasses, got my hat... but no car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car was there! The merchandise was in the trunk! Your instructions were on the cassette!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88                                     6

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Garfield) He wants more money. That's what this is about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me explain something to you. I have a reputation to uphold. People put their trust in me because they know I always deliver the goods and I always come back with the money. This whole thing is making me look very bad... professionally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is bullshit! The car was there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
