dialogues.text: That's right. The parking attendant thought we were off for Hawaii.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a brief pause) The parking attendant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He liked the car. We'd put on those damn loud shirts so we'd look like tourists --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He asked us if we were going surfing. He was a jerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Webster suddenly gets to his feet, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I just realized that in                     * twenty years of service no other                      * client has ever seen my face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervously)                                    * I don't think that's a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Webster pulls out a silencer-equipped pistol and puts a bullet in each of their foreheads. They lie very still and very dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88                  63A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess you're right.                 *

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED 78
dialogues.text: &                                                &amp
TWINS - Rev. 4/27/88                                64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Webster emerges from Garfield's office and then turns back as if to say goodbye, watched by Garfield's Secretary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for everything, guys. I'll see what I can do about those Laker tickets. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'll tell her. Webster closes the door behind him, smiles charmingly at Garfield's Secretary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They want you to hold their calls. They're going to be working late.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 87

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Julius jogs steadily uphill, checking the occasional house number against the address on Vince's letter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An imposing security gate stands wide open as several cars roll through it and climb up the long driveway. Julius, checking the address, sprints in after them just before the gates close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Julius jogs up to the front door. The circular driveway is filled with cars. Adults and children are visible on the grounds; it appears that a party is in progress. Julius rings the doorbell, which is answered by GRANGER, a man of about 60; he's dressed in swimming trunks and sports an impressive physique. He's holding the hand of a five-year-old GIRL. Julius and Granger look at one another and, for a brief moment, hesitate, as if each of them finds the other vaguely familiar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/27/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (after a beat) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm terribly sorry to disturb your party and I realize this might sound strange, but I'm looking for someone who lived here a long time ago... (finally) Mary Anne Benedict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Granger reacts; he's speechless. Julius hands him the group photo of his mother, six fathers, Traven, and Werner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was my mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Granger looks at the photo, then at Julius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Mary Anne's son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing at photo) Isn't that you, Grandpa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius gently takes the photo from the Girl, looks at the face she pointed at, then at Granger. Now Julius is speechless -- Granger is one of his fathers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Girl) Why don't you go help your grandma with lunch, honey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The little Girl disappears back inside.       Granger, cl shaken, looks at Julius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They told your mother that you died at birth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON Julius's reaction, as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trophies, framed photos, other memorabilia of Granger's illustrious football career adorn the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/2/88                                    66

dialogues.speaker: D88 CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Julius studies them admiringly while Granger looks at the group photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you could say I'm your father...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of my fathers --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wistfully studying photo) 'Mary Anne Benedict'... I haven't said her name aloud for over 30 years. She was the love of my life. (shaking his head) The times I've wondered what would have happened if I'd married her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turned me down. Said she was afraid to have children. She took it real hard when they told her you died. She even stopped painting. Did you know she painted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until yesterday I didn't even know she might still be alive... Who told her we died?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'We'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a twin brother, Vincent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's two of you? She never knew that, either. This really gets to Granger -- the injustice of it all. He points to Traven's face in the photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mitchell Traven. He supervised the experiment for the government.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/25/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the one responsible for all of this. He still runs the genetics lab at Los Alamos, New Mexico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch out for him -- he's kind of a dickhead, if you know what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I don't -- but I'm learning.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: & 89

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Cadillac enters through a gate and makes its way past the hulks of dead cars towards the same body shop we saw earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Vince cleans out the glove compartment, pocketing some cigars and spare change. He pulls the cassette out of the STEREO, glances at it, pops it back in, turns it ON, and hears:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Webster, I hope you're happy with the vehicle we chose for your little journey. When you get to Houston, phone 713/555-0342 and                        * ask for Beetroot McKinley. He will arrange to trade you a briefcase for the merchandise in the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/27/88

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Vince stops the car dead, the Body Shop Owner comes up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New Caddy? Let's check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the chop shop Owner checks under the hood of the Caddy -- Vince moves to the back of the car and pops open the trunk. The trunk is filled with a sleeping bag that might contai a dead body. Vince unzips the bag, sees some kind of giant engine part. He tries to lift it out -- It won't budge. Vince closes the trunk -- Vince looks at the Owner who's already counting out the cash from his bankroll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car's okay -- I'll give you three grand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deciding and getting in the car) Sorry -- the car's been promised for a kid's charity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, four grand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Vince starts to drive away:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) Okay -- Six thousand -- that's as high as I'm going...

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A piece   of paper by the phone on which Vince is writing It's got   Beetroot McKinley's name and phone number on i And also   one amount: $20,000. On the desk is a map with Houston   circled. Vince has just finished dialing. The phone is   picked up before the first ring is half over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/27/88                                   70

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sign on the top of the building reads:   "McKinley Aerospace."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beetroot McKinley talkin'.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE'S APARTMENT
dialogues.text: He doesn't know whether to shit or wind his watch just now -- God knows what he's into. McKINLEY(V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's cloggin' up the line?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (experimentally) -- Uh... Webster -- calling from California. I happen to have some merchandise you might want --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 102   INT. McKINLEY'S OFFICE - DAY A huge office in Houston. We are looking at the bottom of a pair of fancy boots. It blocks the view for the moment of the speaker, but we can see a briefcase on the desk. McKINLEY                                  * Well, bring it to me, son, and let me enrich you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the amount of enrichment I want to talk about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boots down now -- we are looking at a very rich, very tough S.O.B. McKINLEY Don't try and renegotiate with Old Beetroot, son --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edgy. His pencil bounces up and down on the crucial amount, the twenty thousand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Beetroot -- if we can't renegotiate we wither and die. I'm not delivering any goddam Cadillac without knowing for sure I got twenty for my cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 104   INT. McKINLEY'S OFFICE Beetroot.    Exploding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: McKINLEY Listen, you little shit-for-brains peckerwood, you're out of your goddam crazy diseased greedy mind!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can see the briefcase now by the way -- it's open and seems quite full of money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: clearing his throat, taken aback by the violence of Beetroot's tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess twenty seems a little high to you. I'm a reasonable guy -- I'll take fifteen -- McKINLEY (V.O.) Listen to me, you poor excuse for a warmed over turd, a deal's a deal --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- But --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 106   INT. McKINLEY'S OFFICE - CLOSEUP - McKINLEY - DAY McKINLEY Don't 'but' me, the deal is five --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can do better than five here. McKINLEY (on his feet -- in a fury) If you can do better than five million dollars, take it!                               *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as the words "five million dollars" really sink in. We are looking at what just might be the high moment of his life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/2/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hard to breathe) F-five million dollars...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He writes down the proper amount now:       $5,000,000. he kisses the piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Beetroot? McKINLEY (V.O.) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you in Houston -- after all, fair is fair. (staring at the written $5,000,000) I'll just have to find it in my heart to live with your offer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince hangs up, jumps up and screams with joy. He puts the cassette in his pocket, crumples up the piece of paper, and sky-hooks it into the waste basket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five million dollars!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Al and his wife Carla are tied to chairs in the dining room. Webster sits between them, drinking a cup of coffee and calmly loading his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your boss at the lot told me you were on duty when the Cadillac clocked in. Now what's his name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... His name is Vince Benedict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Webster puts down the gun, jots down the name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's certainly a beginning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Al) I'm really disappointed in you -- ratting on your best friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/2/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Carla) My best friend who's been screwing my wife for three years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All three years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating Webster; angry) And you never told me until there was a stranger listening? Shit, what about my reputation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where can I find Mister Benedict?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me get this right -- You're protecting the weasel who's been                        * screwing your wife for the past three years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess I'll have to beat it out of you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Webster suddenly kicks over the chair with Al on it. Carla screams --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop -- I'll tell -- He lives at 1622 Westridge Place -- He's got an office at the corner of Highland and Hollywood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Webster writes it all down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for saving me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always loved you, Al.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/27/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just I couldn't resist Vince. It's those eyes -- he does this thing with his eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too, Carla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting up, heading for the door, shaking his head) No one's gonna believe this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Vince comes out of     his house, carrying a sleeping pillow, some clothing,     a six-pack of soft drinks. On of the stack is a map     of the Western U.S., which he's studying while singing     the song "Houston":

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing) 'Going back to Houston, Houston, Houston...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince tosses the items into the back seat of the Caddy, just as Julius jogs up the driveway and collapses against the Caddie door. He's red in the face, completely drenched with sweat, gasping for breath, having run all the way from Bel-Air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (startled) Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (panting) Vince, the most amazing thing has happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You scared the living shit out of me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I met one of our fathers. He told me of a man in New Mexico who probably knows where Momma is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/27/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (patronizing) Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius, in his fervor, grips Vince by the shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She didn't abandon you -- she didn't even know you were born!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feigning concern) Awww -- that's terrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince removes Julius's hands, slides him away from the door, and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she was told that I died!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Julius, I'm in kind   of a hurry. Sammy wants me to    take the car to Houston. Much    bigger bucks when you raffle for   charity in Houston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius takes the map from Vince, looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited) -- New Mexico is on the way to Houston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snatching back map) A lot of places are on the way to Houston. I'll be back in a few days. Stay in my apartment. Run up my phone bill. Throw wild parties. Take advantage of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince gets in behind the wheel. Julius marches around the car and gets into the passenger seat beside him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincent, we have to go see this man Traven in New Mexico!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No we don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius slams his hand down on the top of the dash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/2/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes we do!   And I'm coming with you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince, realizing that Julius won't be denied, tries a new tack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know -- you're right. This is fate -- destiny -- But there's no way I'm gonna drive for 1500 miles with you smelling like that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calming down) You're right -- I'll take a shower -- be right back --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius leaps out of the car and bounds into Vince's apartment. As soon as the door shuts behind him, Vince hits the CADDY'S IGNITION and begins SQUEALING out of the driveway in reverse... just as Linda and Marnie's car pulls into it, blocking his path. Vince slams his hands down onto the wheel in frustration. Linda and Marnie get out of their car, singing "Happy Birthday." Linda approaches Vince with a birthday cake, complete with lit candles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Why does everybody have to like me so much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince gets out of the car and, although it kills him, tries to put on a happy face for Linda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy birthday, Vince.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh please -- It's not my birthday anymore --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Happy birthday, Vince.   Is Julius around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's inside.                                            *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marnie walks into the house. Linda gazes at Vince's belongings in the Caddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/2/88                                     8

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crestfallen) Where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nowhere --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were going somewhere -- you weren't even going to say goodbye --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince, knowing when he's beat, whispers conspiratorially.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay -- look, you can't tell anybody this -- not even your sister -- but I'm onto something so huge it gives me a rash just thinking about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got something in here -- (pats the trunk) -- I don't even know what it is -- that's worth a fortune!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrieks) A fortune! That's great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An apartment door opens, revealing a FEMALE NEIGHBOR of Vince's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never sleep with that man. Never loan him money. And never believe a word he tells you -- that's free advice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She slams the door shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if innocent) I borrowed a cup of sugar from her once...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming with you. I'm not letting you out of my sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am because if you say 'no' one more time -- (suddenly shouting) -- I'll tell everybody you're hiding a fortune in your --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a hand over her mouth; he's beaten and he knows it) Okay, okay. Just don't let on to Julius. He thinks we're going to look up our ancestors, like in 'Roots' or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marnie snoops around, examines the group photo lying on top of Julius's suitcase. In the b.g. she can hear Julius singing in the shower --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Put on your red dress, baby, 'cause we're going out tonight...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She puts the photo back as the sound of SHOWER STOPS. Julius emerges from the bathroom, clutching a towel around his waist, and freezes at the sight of Marnie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) Marnie -- excuse me -- I was just taking a shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding up a box                                * of cookies)                                     * I heard you singing -- I baked some cookies for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess it was a dumb idea.                             *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all -- I'm really looking forward to tasting them. (a beat)                                           * I should put on some clothes -- But I'm not sure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh -- don't mind me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns her back to him. Julius realizes he has no clean shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope Vince doesn't mind if I borrow one of his shirts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (while eyeing Julius through her compact) Just don't try wearing his pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both turn as --

dialogues.speaker: LINDA
dialogues.text: throws open the door, with a big smile on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess what? Vince just invited us all to go to New Mexico and Texas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince comes in behind Linda, trying to conceal his exasperation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a great idea, Vince.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAR, Vince at the wheel, ROARING away, the four of them happily inside. HOLD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Now, from the opposite direction comes another car. Webster is driving. He spots the address, turns in and as he does --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's pretty much a shambles as Webster ransacks the place. Frustrated, he moves out of the room as we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Webster begins working it over. He lifts up the mattress -- it's heavy -- pushes it to the floor and knocks the wastebasket over.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE'S CRUMPLED PIECE OF PAPER
dialogues.text: As Webster unfolds it, reads Beetroot McKinley's name, phone number, and the sum "5 million dollars." Vince's CAT appears at Webster's feet, MEOWING. He reaches down and strokes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Webster is feeding the cat when he hears a sudden, VIOLENT POUNDING at the front door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open up, Benedict! I know you're in there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to cat) Your owner seems to be a very popular fellow these days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it crashes open, revealing Burt Klane and his two large brothers, Bob and Morris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88                                   87B

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Morris has his elbow in a sling and a bandage on his head, courtesy of Julius. They spread out... and then freeze at the sound of RUNNING WATER from the kitchen tap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the Klanes burst inside and see Webster turn off the tap and begin drying his hands. He's friendly, solicitous, definitely non-threatening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howdy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not really important, is it? I wanted to feed the cat before I left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Webster starts for the door. Morris (the really big one) blocks the doorway, cutting Webster off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked you a question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Webster shrugs, exhales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (helping out) We're the Klane brothers. That's Burt and Morris -- I'm Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interesting genetic pool. You're looking for Vince Benedict, right? The brothers all nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I Vince Benedict? Morris stares hard at him, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the difference who I am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hit him, Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bob steps forward. Before he can do anything, Webster pulls out his GUN and SHOOTS him in the foot. Then Webster turns and SHOOTS Burt in the foot. The two brothers crumble to the floor, screaming in agony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Morris) Your brothers seem to have a problem with their feet. (dangerously to Morris) It could be contagious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morris immediately backs away and lets Webster pass by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (polite, as he leaves) Have a good, good day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sign reads:    WELCOME TO ARIZONA.      The CADDY ROARS by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )J(    TWINS - Rev. 6/16/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda, in the front seat, has her head resting on Vince's shoulder. Marnie has her head on Julius's shoulder as well. She seems peacefully asleep while Julius sits carefully not daring to move. As Marnie cuddles closer to him, her short skirt rides even higher up her thighs. Julius sighs deeply. His biceps bulge and one of the shirt sleeves tears apart at the seams. Vince watches through the rearview mirror, knows what's going on. Or rather, what isn't going on, yet. He drives on through the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car speeds by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car is being serviced.    Linda and Marnie are stretc ing their legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did Julius like the cookies? Marnie shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure... he said they'd provide one hundred percent of the average daily requirement of fourteen source vitamins in a high-fiber form that's an integral part of a properly balanced diet. Linda looks at her.    A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really hope so.

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: )J(    TWINS - Rev. 6/16/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince picks out a T-shirt from the racks for Julius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This ought to fit you. Julius removes the shirt he borrowed from Vince, who pretends to be horrified at the sight of Julius's huge muscles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa -- get away from that window! There's women and children out there! (staring at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You allergic to something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are those bumps doing all over your body? You're all swelled up. You look like you're about to explode.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 6/22/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally getting it) We can't all be born beautiful like you, Vince. Some of us --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius puts on the T-shirt and looks at himself in a mirror. Emblazoned across its front is a Hells Angel Death head and the motto: BORN TO BE BAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Are just born to be bad. It's you, Julius. Oooh, you are so scary...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda and Marnie watch by the car as the boys emerge from the shop. They stare at the T-shirt on Julius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he walks past, Julius slaps her five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's rock and roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He opens the car door and climbs in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the girls) It's his first T-shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car driving along.    Day now.     Spectacular scener

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Vince pulls the car to a stop in front of the motel. Linda and Marnie get out, followed by Julius, who starts to get into the front seat beside Vince. Marnie touches his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 6/22/88                                    A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius, blushing, climbs into the front seat while Vince leers out the window at Linda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See if you can get us a room with a king-sized bed, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda smiles at him, and winks. Julius, misunderstanding the sleeping arrangements, leans out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Linda or to Vince) That's not necessary. I always sleep on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince looks askance at Julius, then pulls the car away. HOLD ON Linda and Marnie, gazing curiously after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/25/88                                   92

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Caddy drives through this mysterious town in the mountains of New Mexico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius and Vince have parked the car and are walking to a research building. Vince is trying to humor Julius who is full of a quiet confidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now promise me something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/2/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If this professor Traven says he's never heard of Mom, and us twins, and all our dads, and the experiment, I don't want you to be upset. (a beat) -- Because this is entirely possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still think I'm making it all up, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As TRAVEN, now a tanned, fit 70-year-old, stands framed in his office doorway, looking coldly out at Vince and Julius. He looks like more of a prick than ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know who you are and I don't know what you're talking about. Now get the hell out of here before I call security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traven slams the door shut in their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (vindicated) Well, that's that. On to Houston.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He leads a stunned Julius down the corridor, towards several armed security guards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's lying!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your voice down. This place is crawling with security --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the first time in my life, I am -- (looking for the word) -- pissed off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/2/88                                    94

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do this to me. I got a car to deliver. The last thing I need is a detour in the slammer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius furiously stops and turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to make him tell us the truth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traven looks up from some papers on his work table as --

dialogues.speaker: HIS OFFICE DOOR
dialogues.text: comes flying off its hinges and crashes to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: JULIUS
dialogues.text: marches inside, towards a startled Traven, as Vince tries to restrain him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius shrugs Vince aside, approaches Traven and shoves the group photo into his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating photo) That's our mother -- those are our six fathers -- that's Werner -- and that's you! Start talking!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traven decides, turns to Vince.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You turned out just like I thought you would, Vincent. What did you do, escape from prison?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince stops dead, shell-shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... How did you know my name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/28/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reptilian smile) I named you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince's jaw drops as he realizes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit.   It's all true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As CAMERA MOVES SLOWLY DOWN it, we realize this is a reprise of our film's opening location.

dialogues.speaker: LABORATORY DOOR
dialogues.text: Chained and padlocked.      Traven unlocks it, pulls off chains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The very same one we saw in our opening, now covered in dust and cobwebs. Julius and Vince take it all in; they're numb, while Traven seems in control again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This room was sealed as soon as your mother gave birth.

dialogues.speaker: JULIUS
dialogues.text: approaches a delivery table, touches it gently, looks back at Traven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came out first, of course... (indicating Vince) We weren't expecting him.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: gazes at the "blender" we saw Traven demonstrating in 1953.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (awestruck) This must be where you made the milkshake...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/2/88                                   96.

dialogues.speaker: TRAVEN
dialogues.text: gazes contemptuously at Vince.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We weren't making milkshakes. (indicating Julius) We were making the most fully- developed human the world has ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince is not unhappy at this information.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But instead of just one perfect kid, Mom had two of us -- way to go, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong. The embryo split in two, but it didn't split equally. All                        * the purity and strength went into Julius. All the crap that was left over went into what you see in the mirror every morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) Whoa -- I'm the crap?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not true, Vince.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I want to hear this. (to Traven)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm left-over crap? I'm no good?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's wrong. Angry tears well up in Vince's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just look at him --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tellin' me I'm a side effect!?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/2/88                                     9

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dismissive) You haven't got the brainpower to understand this -- Vincent, and I haven't got the time -- show's over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns to go. Julius grabs Traven, slams him up against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at boiling point) Tell us where our mother is...                         * dickhead!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (terrified) Whispering Pines... it's an artists colony... two hundred miles north of Santa Fe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're lying to me. (the famous snarl) I'll be back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius tosses him aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince is sitting in the car, slumped over the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My life just got flushed down the toilet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're wrong, Vincent. Your life's just about to begin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm genetic garbage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88                                    97

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincent, we're twins.                                *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince looks at his brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (patronizing)                                 * I know this is a touchy subject                      * for you, Julius. But the fact is,                    * we don't look the same -- we don't                   * act the same, we don't talk the                      * same -- we don't dress the same.                     *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (angry) So how come if we're the same, we're so damn different.                             *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had six fathers, Vince. We're different parts of a lot of different people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince is starting to get interested again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And remember, I was taken to a beautiful island, protected, educated, loved, given every opportunity to grow, to dream, to create. But you had none of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince remembers. All the bravado about loving being an orphan has gone now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had nobody. Nobody to love you, nobody to trust you, nobody to encourage you. All life taught you was that the only person you could count on was yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears begin to well up in Vince's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the missing part of my life and I'm the missing part of your life. And when we find our mother we can fill the missing part of hers. We won't be alone anymore, Vince. (a beat) We can be a family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince looks at his brother.      A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A family?   You really think so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/22/88

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Julius nods.    Vince thinks about it some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With like Thanksgiving dinner? And Christmas trees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... and a real home where you'll always be welcome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even when you've been bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince begins to brighten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Vince ushers Julius through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this necessary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not introducing you to my mother dressed like some goatsherder from Albania. You need some new clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SALES CLERK approaches Vince.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/28/88                                99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I look like I need help? (indicating Julius) Here's the problem. (looking around) Maybe I'll try on a couple of things myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Vince and Julius emerge, dressed in identical outfits; each in his own way looks like a male model from an Italian fashion magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I look okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look better, put it that way. We got to do something about the way you walk. You're moving a tad stiff, Jules. Ever see                         * Frankenstein?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not gonna help. You got to walk like you're moving in time to music. I'm not talking about military marches now, I mean Aretha Franklin, Otis Redding, Wilson Pickett, Archie Bell and the Drells and a couple of white                   * guys.                                              *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius doesn't have a clue. Vince dons sunglasses and demonstrates a soulful strut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like this... You just got to try to be cool, you know? Try these on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indicating glasses. Julius puts on sunglasses, snaps his fingers, tries to ape Vince's moves while Vince appraises him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I cool now? --                                  *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Ice.                                           *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/28/88                                  100

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda and Marnie look up in amazement as Vince and Julius bop down the pavement towards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excited)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know where to find our momma!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything Julius said was true. I'm the product of geniuses!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always knew that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, but it's nice to make it official.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommorrow we're going to finally meet our mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And tonight we celebrate!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince is finishing dressing, making sure he looks partic- ularly fantastic. Julius hangs back; something is bothering him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embarrassed; a burst)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince, you've got to help me -- I've never been out on a date before... what should I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to her, buy her some drinks, dance with her. Girls like to dance. Julius looks at his brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/22/88                                  100

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess you haven't done that before either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Julius shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- forget all that disco shit, everyone's seen it. When I really want to romance a girl, I waltz with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You dance with them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It turns them to putty in your hands.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: He shoves a chair out of the way, making a little room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, come here, put your feet by my feet --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (coming over) -- Thank you for this, Vince --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a pained look on his face) -- I said put your feet by my feet not on my feet! --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius looks at his brother, then self-consciously takes his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll lead, you follow. Okay, one, two, three, turn... (AD LIB as follows)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... put your arm here -- you're breaking my fingers -- you're not wrestling a boar 300 miles south southwest of Fiji -- don't clench your teeth -- Vince begins to take Julius through the steps slowly at first, then as Julius gains confidence they begin to sail round the room, and we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88                                    10

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius and Marnie in the middle of the large dance floor in a large club -- and Julius is waltzing magnificently. Marnie, thrilled, stays with him step for step as we -- PULL BACK to reveal -- Vince and Linda, waltzing brilliantly, too. The four of them have the whole floor to themselves as other dancers ring the area, watching and shouting encouragement. The SONG ENDS -- Everyone applauds -- Our two couples hea over to their table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Julius)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you've learned to waltz. Now it's time to introduce you to the wonderful world of getting shit-faced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince, Linda, Julius and Marnie are seated at a table covered with quite a few empty beer bottles. They are all a little drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know they had beer in ancient Egypt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Er... no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually it was invented by the Assyrians, but the Eygptians were the first people to perfect the malt fermentation process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure know a lot about beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knows a lot about everything. Julius polishes off the bottle, belches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )J(    TWINS - Rev. 6/16/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's all from books. Until tonight I never had a beer. All theory, no practice -- the story of my life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we're going to change all that -- aren't we, Marnie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius, embarrassed, looks over at Marnie, who's smiling sweetly at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask you a question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I shit-faced yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda, surprised, does a spit-take with her beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) You're getting there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please excuse me -- my back teeth are floating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince exits.    Julius looks at Marnie, blushes, gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I better see if mine are, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius takes off after Vince.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Vince and Julius approach the urinals. The both si- multaneously flush before unzipping. Julius smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do that too, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )J(    TWINS - Rev. 6/16/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lying) Not all the time. (a beat) Listen, Marnie's got the hots for you. Tonight could be your lucky night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think she really likes me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Piece of cake. You're nervous 'cause it's your first time. Perfectly natural.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you nervous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was twelve and she was a nun -- that's real pressure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both finish at the urinals and begin washing at the sink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got to admit it, Jules -- since I met you, life is getting better all the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius, a little smashed, can't hide his feelings.    He grips Vince by the shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For me, too, Vince! Sometimes I'm so happy, I want to pick you up and hug you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius starts to do so, just as another man enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, cut it out! Not in here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius releases Vince, who clocks the other man's reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Julius) Go easy on the beer, okay?

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: )J(   TWINS - Rev. 6/16/88 138   INT. McKINLEY'S OFFICE - NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lookin' forward to it. As Beetroot hangs up, the CAMERA SLOWLY PANS to reveal he is not alone. In the b.g. is a very hard-looking man, Beetroot's bodyguard. And standing close to the desk is WEBSTER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Webster)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Webster, looks like I'm doin' business with someone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd do the same thing. You want the delivery, it's not your problem who delivers. (handing him a card)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you ever need me, my answering service forwards all messages. And he's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (handing card to bodyguard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put this in my personal file. (staring at the door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I love a professional...

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: & 140 TWINS - Rev. 5/2/88                                     1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda and Marnie, both a little tipsy. Linda suddenly freezes at the sight of Morris Klane scoping the room. Morris is still wearing a bandage from his beating by Julius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you tell anybody we were coming to Santa Fe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unconcerned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I phoned work and told them we wouldn't be coming in for a few days... Oh, I forgot to tell you -- we've been fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tight-lipped)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go to the ladies' room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we just went. Linda takes Marnie by the hand, just as --

dialogues.speaker: BURT AND BOB KLANE
dialogues.text: each with a cast on his foot, each supported by a crutch, force them back into the booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, girls -- Do you mind if we sit down and enjoy the music with you?

dialogues.speaker: VINCE AND JULIUS
dialogues.text: approach the table. Burt and Bob open their jackets, revealing they have guns on the girls. Morris Klane appears behind Vince and Julius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has gone way past a simple case of loan deliquency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't like getting shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?    We didn't shoot anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no way to do business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want to take Vince out to the parking lot and kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's kind of drastic, don't you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morris grabs Vince roughly by the arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ominous) Don't touch him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly rough)                                  * This is not your problem -- you don't want me to hurt these lovely ladies, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes his gun into Marnie's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cries out) -- Ow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You moved too soon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The second rule in a crisis situation:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wary) He's starting that funny talk again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88                                 107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you choose to bluff, you must be prepared to have your bluff called.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is no bluff -- Asshole --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burt gives a small head signal and two very large men stand up from a nearby table. They each grab one of Julius's arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meet my cousins. (to the Klanes) Get these jerks outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, so sudden and quick that it's over as soon as it begins, Julius double kicks the seated Burt and Bob in the head. They're out cold before they realize they've been attacked. Without stopping, Julius whips his arms together in front of him bringing Sam and Dave into painful contact with each others' head. They, too, are now out cold. Vince uses this opportunity to stomp, with all his might, on the toe of Morris who's busy watching Julius dismantle his relatives. Morris screams and lets go of Vince, who runs to the nearby pool table, grabs a cue and slams it over the head of the now hobbling Morris. All five Klanes are out cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many of those... rules do you have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite a few. They were formulated by a Kendo swordsman in the 17th century, but their philosophical underpinnings can be applied to many other areas of life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet.

dialogues.speaker: A142 OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 143

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: )O(   TWINS - Rev. 7/5/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius is unpacking his suitcase on one of the beds -- arranging his books on the bedside table, hanging his clothes on hangars. Vince watches him, glances at his watch, and begins to edge towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... we got cable TV, a fully stocked bar, free ice -- we're in great shape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I'd just go and tuck Linda in for the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince picks up one of Julius' heavy tomes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe read her a bedtime story. (with a wink) Don't wait up for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius looks fondly at his brother as he sees him to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a day, Vincent, we visited our birth place. We bought new clothes. We danced the waltz. We get into a fight -- We've got this great room. (heart-felt) It just doesn't get any better than this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince gives Julius a sly look as he lets himself out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes it does.

dialogues.speaker: A TV SCREEN
dialogues.text: showing a clip of the "3 Stooges" at their moronic best.

dialogues.speaker: JULIUS
dialogues.text: sits watching the TV, nodding in amusement, laughing, slapping his knee in pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )O(   TWINS - Rev. 7/5/88

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He returns his attention to the book he's been reading -- something the size of a dictionary -- but can't help returning his gaze to the TV. He freezes at the sound of a KNOCK at the DOOR. Embar- rassed by what he's been watching, he quickly turns off the TV, and goes to answer the door, still holding the book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) You forgot your key -- I know. Lucky I waited up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius opens the door, revealing Marnie, who walks in right past him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/28/88                                    1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.                                                     *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi -- Vince and Linda want to be                        * alone, so I'm afraid I'm going to stay here. Which bed should I take?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) Either... I always sleep on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watched by Julius, Marnie pulls the curtains shut, kills the overhead lights, all the while providing him with glimpses of various parts of her anatomy. She gets into one of the beds, turns off the bedside lamp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius puts the blanket and pillow from the other bed onto the floor between the two beds, then shuts off the other lamp. Silence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This mattress is awful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting out of bed, she pulls the blanket and pillow with her as she steps over Julius, who tries not to look up, and gets into the other bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.   Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This mattress is just as bad as the other one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets out, again dragging the blanket and pillow, puts them down on the floor next to Julius. She crawls under the blanket, turns her back to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )O(   TWINS - Rev. 7/5/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is better... Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.     Marnie shivers, chattering her teeth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you cold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, please, take my shirt.      I'm               * baking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius strips it off and hands it to her. She puts it on and pulls the blanket over her shoulder. Again she shivers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still cold?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just my legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius lies there, thinking about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I could give you my...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sitting up) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius reaches under the blanket, removes his bottoms and passes them over. Marnie puts them on under her blanket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love a glass of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizes that he's now nude) Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wraps his blanket around his waist, goes into the bathroom, comes out with a glass of water. He hands it to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/28/88                                    1

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She spills the water all over her top and bedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts stripping off everything she's wearing.      J averts his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you mind if I share your blanket? -- Mine's all wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gulps) No -- that would be okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both lie down under his blanket.      Silence...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could we switch sides?   I like to sleep on the left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to roll over Julius, then pauses directly above him and looks him dead in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask you something for a change?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like me? I mean, even a little bit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... I'm crazy about you, Marnie. But there's something about me you ought to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marnie tenses, expecting the worst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking away) I'm a virgin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88                                    11

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Marnie glances heavenward, and silently mouths the words "thank you." She smiles down at Julius and starts very gently kissing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda, dressed in a negligee, comes out of the bathroom area. Vince, wearing pajamas, is on the floor, legs curled under the bed, doing sit-ups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath; counting) -- Eighteen -- nineteen --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sick or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius gave me a few pointers -- (counting) -- Seventy-five -- seventy-six -- I don't need to exercise, but Mom's gonna see me for the first                       * time in thirty-five years, I wanna look my best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'll love you whatever you look like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know she will -- I have that effect on people -- (counting) -- One hundred and forty-three --                      * one forty-four --                                      * (beat) -- I just hope she's not too disappointed in Julius -- he can't help how weird he seems at the start --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )T(   TWINS - Rev. 7/5/88 PM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- I sleep great every night -- (beat; softer) -- what if she's disappointed in me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pats the bed) C'mere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (final sit-up) Five hundred. (gets up) Don't want to overdo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He goes into her arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she's disappointed in you, then she's a fake -- who could want more from a son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (thinking about it) You're right. (a beat) I couldn't do this without you, Linda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. That's why, when we get back, I think we should move in together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (threatened) Whoa!   Move in together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not saying we have to    get married or anything, and    it's not about me wanting to keep    an eye on you, either. (warmly) I just want to live with    you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm no good at playing house -- I'm grouchy in the morning, cranky in the afternoon, moody at night --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )T(   TWINS - Rev. 7/5/88 PM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise not to try and make you happy unless you want me to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince is clearly unnerved by the twin emotional demands of Linda and meeting his mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we sleep on this, okay? I mean, I've got a big day tomorrow. (shifting gears) It's gonna be great -- taking my best girl to meet my mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I really your best girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nobody else, Linda, not anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There better not be, because... (quoting) 'I only have eyes for you...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/28/88                                   11

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're both gazing up at the ceiling, bathed in after- glow. Marnie has obviously just had the sexual experience of her life. Julius is equally dazed and happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure you've never done this before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I would have remembered... They start to kiss and we start to hear four RAUCOUS VOICES singing a great old ROCK SONG a capella.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's our heroes singing. The Cadillac is moving quickly through the extraordinary landscape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Caddy pulls up by a roadside flower stand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/22/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get her some flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good idea. One bunch from me, one from Jules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And one from us --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius smiles happily at Vince's thoughtfulness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the mountains, which dramatically tower over a lovely, wide park-like area with a large adobe building and a few smaller satellite huts. The car drives up a long, dusty driveway to the entrance, which is protected by high gates. Our principals exit the car. They approach the fortress-like gated entrance, gazing around at the magnificent scenery. Both men carry flowers and seem self-conscious about the prospect of finally meeting their mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very beautiful, isn't it, Vince?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not to mention valuable -- real estate like this must be worth a fortune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a rebuke) You mustn't always think of money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (innocent) You got me wrong -- I'm just saying it's nice Mom's loaded -- that's a worry she won't have to have in her old age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius smiles at Vince and rings the bell. A MALE CUSTODIAN answers the door -- friendly but very firm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/2/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd like to see Miss Mary Anne Benedict, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid that's not possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he starts to close the door, Vince takes charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've come a long way. I can assure you she's going to be very happy to see us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suggest you write a letter to the Benedict Foundation stating your business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Custodian politely closes the door in their faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A foundation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our principals circle the wall, try a locked door to no avail. They'll have to go over. Julius boosts Marnie over the wall. Linda boosts Vince over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our principals take in the scene -- a large, enclosed garden, with pathways, shady trees, all very lovely, with a great view of the sun setting against the surrounding mountains. Their attention is drawn to -- A PAINTER working at an easel. Several young artists are gathered around her, admiringly. This is happening underneath a beautiful old tree and the sight is just lovely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/2/88                                    11

dialogues.speaker: THE QUARTER
dialogues.text: They stand still watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (indicating the bucolic scene) You think it's her? I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta be. (as they still stare)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, don't just stand there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Introduce yourselves.                                   * As they take a step in the direction of the painter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sharp and loud) Hey!

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE GARDNER
dialogues.text: on her knees. She's in work clothes, smudged, hair in a bandana. Maybe 60, there's something terribly appealing about her. She's her own woman. She gets up from her knees now as they approach -- but not before we note the quality of her gardening -- it's the size Julius had back on the island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should you be here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tries to joke) That depends on how you feel personally about trespassing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (umamused; to Julius about Vince) Is he always funny like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very politely) We'd like to see Mary Ann Benedict please; is she here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/28/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Course she's here -- (shakes her head) -- climbing over the wall like that, I should call the police --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't do that -- look -- this isn't one of your average everyday situations -- she's our mother is the thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're her sons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twin sons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- You're comedians --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're kind of a surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes off her gardening gloves) I'll bet you are -- follow me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leads them towards the painter who glances up from her easel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering to Julius) We were right --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) -- It is her --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the Gardener leads them past the painter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) We thought that that woman --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Is Mary Ann?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- This is an artist's colony; there's a lot of painters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/28/88                                  120

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is some chunk of real estate -- Mom owns it all, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are heading toward a door in the garden wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't really own something like that view over there, or that sunset, can you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a believer) No, of course not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Linda and Marnie) I can't wait to meet her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gardener ushers them towards a door in the garden wall. She opens it, politely stands back, letting them go through it. They turn back to look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Anne Benedict never understood why people wanted to buy her paintings. But for a brief period they were considered valuable. She used the money to buy Whispering Pines so that young artists would have a place to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/22/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not famous anymore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She never wanted to be famous. She just wanted to be left alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I ask you a question? (a beat, concerned) Why do you keep referring to her in the past tense?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because she passed away, some time ago.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE AND JULIUS
dialogues.text: They look like they've been kicked in the stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But -- but you said she was here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She is -- I meant her spirit.   Her spirit is always here. (a beat) Excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gardener gently closes the door in their faces.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE AND JULIUS
dialogues.text: They haven't moved. Linda and Marnie try to console them. Julius still doesn't move. Vince shakes Linda off and stomps away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince, out in front, hurls his   flowers to the ground, kicks them, then hurries toward   the Caddy. Julius, stil carrying his bouquet, picks up   Vince's flowers, then places the two bouquets into a   niche in the wall. Marni joins him and adds her flowers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/28/88

dialogues.speaker: A151 CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The sound of the Caddy's HORN HONKING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (behind the wheel) Can we get the hell out of here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gardener is back at work, staking up her tomatoes, as the female Painter approaches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that all about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These real estate developers won't be happy until they turn this place into a golf course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now they're climbing over the walls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're shameless. They'll try anything. (bitterly amused) Those men claimed to be my twin sons, if you can believe that. It was really quite disturbing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Mary Anne, I am sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright... You get over things. (with a sigh) I did have a child once, but he died at birth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius, Vince, Linda and Marnie are quietly sitting at a roadside table, eating some junk food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 6/22/88                                   12

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ought to be so proud of your mother, Vince. She donated her house and her land and all her paintings to help young artists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I look like a young artist to you, Linda?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gently) Vince, all she meant was --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picking a fight) I know what she meant. And I know why she's here, too. It's got nothing to do with my mother and everything to do with money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know that's not true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hard) Bull-shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius, who's been quiet and distant throughout, suddenly intercedes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it easy, Vincent.   It's not her fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear that, everybody? The                          * creature from the black lagoon                         * just put in his two bits. I                            * should have my head examined for listening to you in the first place -- deal-of-a-lifetime opportunity and I'm driving around looking for a dead mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very sad) All I wanted was to make us into a family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stands up) Family, my butt. There's no family here. There's just me and three losers -- I'm leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 6/22/88

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Vince storms off, gets into the Caddy and squeals away, throwing Julius's suitcase out the window as he goes. Linda and Marnie take off after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince -- quit acting crazy --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) He dumped us in the middle of New Mexico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be fine. And maybe he'll be better off alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know -- he's got something worth maybe millions in that trunk -- he could get himself killed delivering it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's been getting out of trouble all his life, he's good at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He may need you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (voice flat, dead) I don't know much anymore -- on the island I was smart. Here, I've only made things worse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you realize you could make things a lot worse if you don't do something. (gently; close beside him now)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
