dialogues.text: Julius -- you're still very smart it's just you're not thinking so well right now -- on account of what you found out at Whispering Pines -- but you're not alone, you know -- I mean, you live long enough, everyone's mother dies... No reaction from Julius.    It's impossible to tell what he's thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88                                  124A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: in the Cadillac.   He's driving very fast and is on the car phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Beetroot -- It's time. I'll be there tomorrow -- where do we meet and trade?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/2/88

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 169

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius is saying goodbye to Linda and Marnie.     He's carrying his leather suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Linda) Don't worry, Linda. I found him once, I'll find him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be careful...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius gives Marnie a rather chaste kiss.

dialogues.speaker: JULIUS
dialogues.text: He turns away.

dialogues.speaker: MARNIE
dialogues.text: watching.

dialogues.speaker: JULIUS
dialogues.text: spinning back, grabbing her up, folding her into his arms, planting a world-class kiss on her mouth. HOLD ON the two of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts on his sunglasses and strides into the airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taking off in the New Mexico sunset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88                                 125A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cadillac driving into town.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: He's real serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With planes landing in the early morning behind him, we see --

dialogues.speaker: JULIUS
dialogues.text: standing -- waiting -- trying to pick up the scent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius strides purposefully along, carrying his suitcase. He reaches a sign-posted intersection, looks in all di- rections, chooses one, begins to move. As he does, a CREEP starts walking along with him, eyeing his suitcase, just like the Biker did when Julius first arrived in Hollywood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds up cigarette)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a light, pal?                                      * Julius, without breaking stride, turns his head, looks at the Creep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scary)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fuck with me... pal. The Creep falls back.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Vince pulls up in the Caddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88                                 126.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He drives inside a large warehouse, parks, gets out and looks warily around. He opens the trunk, unzips the sleeping bag, revealing the merchandise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step away from that car, Mr. Benedict. Vince turns to see Beetroot coming out of the warehouse, accompanied by his BODYGUARD carrying an attache case and holding a gun. The Bodyguard pats Vince down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we had a deal here. The Bodyguard ignores him, checks out the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Beetroot)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Vince)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You come here alone, unarmed? You're just a fool who stole a car, aren't you? It's a new, low-                      * cost fuel-injection system for                         * jet engines -- worth a fortune to                      * the company that brings it to the                      * market first.                                          * (ruthlessly; to                                 * Bodyguard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you waiting for? Vince closes his eyes, waiting for the bullet that he knows is coming. When he opens his eyes the Bodyguard is holding the attache case open to show him the five million dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five million dollars --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna count it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trust you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88                                    12

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Vince takes the case, gazes at the money, snaps it shut. He can't believe he's pulled it off. Beetroot and the Bodyguard get into the Cadillac. The Caddy speeds away while Vince clutches the attache case to his chest and does a little dance of triumph. The big score at last! TWO SHOTS RING out. Vince freezes and sees --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cadillac suddenly CRASHES against the side of another warehouse. It's HORN is BLARING.

dialogues.speaker: WEBSTER
dialogues.text: emerges from the shadows with a powerful pump action shotgun. He opens the Caddy and pushes the dead Bodyguard off the horn. Beetroot has a hole in his head, as well. Webster turns and gazes back toward Vince who is sprintin for safety. Webster calmly goes after him, reloading his rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's filled with forklifts, cranes and various forms of heavy machinery. Webster enters and looks cautiously around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calling out) All I want is the money, Benedict. Just give me what's mine and you can go back to stealing cars and screwing your best friend's wife.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: hiding behind some machinery, scurries deeper into the bowels of the warehouse.

dialogues.speaker: WEBSTER
dialogues.text: moves forward, stalking him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: crawling along the ground. He spots an open window up ahead at the end of the warehouse. Nearer, to his right, is another window, closed. Vince picks up a piece of pipe, aims, fires it at the closed window and as it breaks the glass --

dialogues.speaker: WEBSTER
dialogues.text: FIRING at the sound. He can't see Vince but he pours his fire at the window Vince broke -- large chunks of the BUILDING EXPLODE off wherever Webster fires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pack it in, Vince, you're only wasting time -- I don't give a damn about you, just the money --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's reloaded during this -- moving forward as we...

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: crouched near the open window, glancing back at Webster who has no idea where he is. Noiselessly, he slides out of the open window, briefcase in hand, starts to run away --

dialogues.speaker: WEBSTER
dialogues.text: moving in on the shattered window.     A bit irritated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince, if you don't cut this horseshit I may have to hurt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over) Leave my brother alone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Webster whirls, looks around --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/2/88                                    12

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince, outside, really chugging away now, doing his best Carl Lewis imitation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius looking down at Webster from the floor above.    H hands are held high. In one of them is a briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gun trained on Julius)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well don't be shy -- (gesturing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- come on down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/28/88                                   13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Vince puts distance between himself and the   warehous Suddenly he stops, as if he's heard or "felt"   something He shakes the feeling off, resumes running...   and then stops again, shuts his eyes tightly, trying to   deny what's happening to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way... this is bullshit... (eyes snapping open)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius, you putz. Vince turns and runs back towards the warehouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: as Julius gracefully shinnies down a cable, lands near Webster. He tosses the suitcase to the ground, backs away. Webster approaches. Julius' hands, as before, are held high over his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just exactly who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vincent's twin brother -- we're in this together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your hands that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be nervous -- I hate violence and I never carry guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince peering in through the window he jumped out of, takes in the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (muttering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddam ESP-psycho-voodoo bullshit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Opening Julius' suitcase. He pulls out Julius' old clothes, tosses them aside, then removes some books, books, and more books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 4/28/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (disgusted) 'Shakespeare's Collected Works'?... 'The Mind of Confucius'?... 'Advanced Quantum Mechanics'?... What is this shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I needed something to read on the airplane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raising rifle) Yeah, well your flying days are over...

dialogues.speaker: SUITCASE WITH THE MONEY
dialogues.text: flying through the air, landing near Webster's feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put the goddam gun away -- you're a multimillionaire.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE
dialogues.text: hands held high, appears, stands beside Julius.

dialogues.speaker: WEBSTER
dialogues.text: He covers them both, kneels, opens Vince's suitcase, glances at the money inside.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE AND JULIUS
dialogues.text: both with their hands up, look at one another and begin arguing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am never going to forgive you for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were going to get killed. I tried to distract him so you could escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had escaped. I was on my way to Brazil -- when I felt you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, why didn't you go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because, thanks to you, I'm now not only a godamn psychic, I've got this disease called a conscience!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody ever said being good was easy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Webster uneasily monitors their argument.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How am I going to survive out there? What are my friends going to think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) You haven't got any friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just what are you two talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Webster) Butt out, okay? This is family stuff, we're squabbling, it's personal, just take the money and go sit in the lap of luxury somewhere. Try Brazil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cocking his shotgun) I doesn't work like that, you might talk to people -- (aiming the rifle now) Who wants it first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoot him.   This whole thing is his fault.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Hold it, don't I get a say in this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Webster points the shotgun at Vince, starts to squeeze the trigger when --

dialogues.speaker: JULIUS
dialogues.text: pulls a gun from his sleeve and blows Webster's weapon out of his hands. Webster screams in pain, clutching his hand, dancing around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amazed) You can be an irritating pain -- but sometimes you come in handy. -- Where'd you get the gun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the dead man in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Webster) You should have checked if he had a gun, chump.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said he didn't believe in them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (proudly) I lied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teasing) Ooooh -- you lied?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince beams with deep fraternal pride.       Then he turn Webster and snatches the case back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like you messed with the wrong people, wise guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Webster shrugs and takes out a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got lucky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He lights it with his lighter.       Suddenly Julius smel something. Bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) But your luck just ran out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stream of gas is pouring out of the drums that Webster punctured whilst he was shooting at Vince. It runs in a broad stream across the warehouse floor, right beneath Julius and Vince's feet. Webster is holding his cigarette out, ready to drop it in the fuel and incin- erate them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop the gun and give me back the case, or we're gonna have ourselves some barbecued Benedict.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius drops the gun and Vince slowly hands back the case. Webster smiles and backs off down the stream of gas, still holding out the cigarette. He stops at the very edge of the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I guess this is goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He raises the cigarette, ready to throw it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Webster looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've forgotten something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Webster grips the case tighter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The third rule in a crisis situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian leans calmly against the warehouse wall, supported by one arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The third rule?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julius's hand has pressed a button in a metal cage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) Duck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly the load hanging from the boom of a nearby crane smashes into Webster's back, and then dumps on him, burying him in rubble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (even more amazed) Duck? (can't believe it) Duck? You are developing real style, Julius.

dialogues.speaker: JULIUS
dialogues.text: drapes his arm around Vince as they walk towards the unharmed attache case full of money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came back for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always knew you would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're my brother, right? (as Julius smiles) We're family, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Vincent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a gleam) We're a rich family, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both reach for the attache case at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're a good family. I'm sorry, Vince, but we have to return the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88                                    13

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Return the money?!? Are you nuts?!? This is dirty money,                            * Julius -- it doesn't belong to anybody --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Including us -- think how much                       * better you'll feel when it's out of our lives --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost jumping up and down) -- I won't -- I won't feel one bit better -- I'll never feel better, not if I live to be... oh no --                         *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the sound of POLICE SIRENS get LOUDER we --

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 176

dialogues.speaker: NEWSPAPER
dialogues.text: A large photo of Vince and Julius being handed a check, with an accompanying headline that reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PULLS BACK to reveal we are --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Anne Benedict, seated at a breakfast table, stares at the newspaper in astonishment. It's being held in front of her by the Painter from the earlier scene, who gently places the newspaper into Mary Anne's hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you'd better read this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWINS - Rev. 5/9/88                                 137A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Traven is reading a newspaper with his feet up on the desk. It has the same headline and photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stole my family, you lying son of a bitch! Traven looks up just as Mary Anne's fist comes crashing into his face and sends him flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )T(    TWINS - Rev. 7/5/88 PM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Linda comes through the door, gets her mail from the mailbox. She turns and comes face-to-face with Vince, standing there with a contrite look on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda, I --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't answer     my calls or my letters, so I...     Look, I made a terrible mistake     and I apologize and I want to tell     you that I'm a changed man. Linda is almost buying it, but then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you get in here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, there was a window in the back that --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (resigned again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Typical. She walks past him, approaches her door, puts in the key. Vince follows, speaking softly, his sincerity absolutely genuine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I ask is for another chance. I know I probably don't deserve it, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right, you don't deserve it. She opens her door, walks in, and slams it in his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sighs, turns from the door, and sees --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )T(    TWINS - Rev. 7/5/88 PM

dialogues.speaker: ROSES
dialogues.text: Dozens of them -- everywhere -- all over her apartment -- beautifully arranged -- in gorgeous vases.

dialogues.speaker: ON LINDA
dialogues.text: Taking it all in, her resistance melting. She turns, flings open the door, looks out -- no sign of Vince... until CAMERA TILTS DOWN to reveal Vince on his knees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to break into your apartment, but --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince, they're beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, do you forgive me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Linda hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince looks at her, understands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, that matter we talked about once and never really resolved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (feigning ignorance) What matter is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The matter of you and me living together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (haltingly) What about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince gets to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your place or mine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They rush into each other's arms. )T(   TWINS - Rev. 7/5/88 PM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It reads: "The Benedict Corporation." CAMERA PULLS BACK to reveal we are -- inside Vince's office. The offices have been redecorated -- they look serious, professional, and are filled with computer terminals and other high-tech equipment. Julius is sorting through a stack of mail while Vince talks to a prospective client on the phone. Both of them are wearing suits and ties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do? Most people on this planet cause problems -- the Benedict Corporation solves them. We're a consulting firm -- a think-tank -- sort of like the Rand Corporation -- only smarter! (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tuesday at three. See you then. Vince hangs up the phone, loosens his tie.     Julius excitedly holds up a stack of letters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this, Vince -- proposals from the Red Cross, UNICEF, the World Health Organization -- we should only have clients who do humanitarian work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as long as they pay -- we're not running a charity, you know. The sound of FOOTSTEPS down the corridor, then a tentative KNOCK at the DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come in!

dialogues.speaker: THE DOOR
dialogues.text: As it opens, revealing Mary Anne Benedict, not looking at all like the gardener they met in Whispering Pines.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE AND JULIUS
dialogues.text: Confused, just look at her for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )O(   TWINS - Rev. 7/5/88

dialogues.speaker: MARY ANNE
dialogues.text: Clearly overwhelmed, struggles to find the appropriate words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so incredible I'm not even sure which one of you is which.

dialogues.speaker: VINCE AND JULIUS
dialogues.text: Look at one another, then at Mary Anne, realizing at the same time that she's their mother!

dialogues.speaker: THREE OF THEM
dialogues.text: Staring at each other in silence, until --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, I didn't believe you, I mean who would believe a story like your story -- crazy -- They lied to me all these years... And they lied to you... But you found one another ... And you found me... Please -- God -- one of you say something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Momma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Anne nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly) Mamma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (anguished wail) MOMMA!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both run to Mary Anne and hug her for all she's worth. They're laughing, crying, holding each other. Slowly, we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )U(    TWINS - Rev. 7/25/88

dialogues.speaker: JULIUS
dialogues.text: Watching them. Now there are tears on his face, too. He goes to them, gently puts his arms around them, lifts them both up in to the air, cradling them. They're laughing.   They're crying.   They're holding eac other. No words are necessary. Slowly...

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 180

dialogues.speaker: WERNER
dialogues.text: Smiling happily.    PULL BACK to reveal we are --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In front of the merry-go-round. Werner purchases a hand- ful of tickets from the vendor, hands one each to Mary Anne, Linda and Marnie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just can't get over how alike they are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three women all turn and gaze affectionately back at --

dialogues.speaker: VINCE AND JULIUS
dialogues.text: Walking along the path behind them. We assume it's them the women were discussing, until we notice that each of them is pushing a double-stroller with identical twin babies inside! It's the twin children that are the source of the women's wonder, and Vince and Julius' as well. Vince and Julius both yawn simultaneously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kepp you up all night again, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: )U(   TWINS - Rev. 7/25/88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sceaming in stereo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both stop the strollers, look down lovingly at their kids, begin fondling them. Vince and Julius, simultan- eously flip identical baby rattles and shake them at their twins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to baby #1) I think you need your diaper changed. (to baby #2) What a surprise -- so do you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince becomes aware of the condition of his kids' diapers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (checks his babies) Not you, too -- It's not a competition, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both start pushing their strollers again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just think what we'd be like if we'd been raised together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that's a scary thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both yawn simultaneously once again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vince and Julius are sitting on adjoining horses. Linda and Marnie hand their sons up to them, watched proudly by Mary Anne. The merry-go-round starts moving, and the last image we see is of Vince and Julius on the horses, holding their twin sons. As they move PAST US, END CREDITS BEGIN TO ROLL.
